title: Graham Greene - Fiction, Plays, and Non-fiction (47 books)
description:
GRAHAM GREENE (1904-1991) was an English novelist, short-story writer, playwright, and journalist regarded by many, including yours truly, as one of the great authors of the 20th century.  Combining literary acclaim with widespread popularity, Greene acquired a reputation early in his lifetime as a major writer, both of serious Catholic novels, and of thrillers (or "entertainments" as he termed them), often with a notable philosophic edge.  He was shortlisted for the Nobel Prize but, to the enduring discredit of the Swedish Academy, never won it.

Although Greene objected strongly to being described as a Roman Catholic novelist, rather than as a novelist who happened to be Catholic, religious themes are at the root of much of his writing, especially the four major Catholic novels on which he thought his literary reputation would rest: BRIGHTON ROCK (1938), THE POWER AND THE GLORY (1940), THE HEART OF THE MATTER (1948), and THE END OF THE AFFAIR (1951), which are regarded as "the gold standard" of the Catholic novel.  Several works, such as THE CONFIDENTIAL AGENT (1939), THE THIRD MAN (1949), THE QUIET AMERICAN (1955), OUR MAN IN HAVANA (1958), and THE HUMAN FACTOR (1978), also show Greene's avid interest in the workings and intrigues of international politics and espionage.

The world Greene's characters inhabit is a fallen one, and the tone of his works emphasizes the presence of evil as a palpable force.  His novels display a consistent preoccupation with sin and moral failure acted out in seedy locales characterized by danger, violence, and physical decay.  Greene's chief concern is the moral and spiritual struggles within individuals, but the larger political and social settings of his novels give such conflicts an enhanced resonance.

The non-fiction collected here includes several volumes of autobiography, travel writings, essays, film criticism, and biography.

Thank you to @sniffn and @anmisto for your kind assistance. 

The following books are in ePUB format unless otherwise indicated:
